availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison H. Barrett (Owsley Co, farmer and pvt 1st Ky light artillery )

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Barrett and Matilda Barrett. Married to Levisa Barrett. Father of George Barrett. Resident in Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private from September 10, 1863. Reported as deserted from Mt. Sterling, Kentucky, on April 19, 1864. Returned to service and mustered out on July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 34A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Proctor, p. 381.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lee County, Old Landing, p. 326B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0147.
